oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dolly Parton interview - Joe Suglia WBUK - 1975-08-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Dolly Parton (performer) conducted by Joe Suglia on August 24, 1975 for radio station WBUK.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Joe Suglia introduces Dolly Parton -- Dolly Parton talks about wanting to do an interview for a long time -- Suglia mentions doing the interview on her tour bus -- Parton talks about her record The Seeker -- Suglia asks about her songwriting process -- Parton says she can sit down and write a song or they will just come to her -- Parton says that she is 29 years old and not old enough to lie about her age yet -- Parton talks about her outlook on life and how happy she is -- Parton talks about having a few throat problems, and some more severe past throat issues -- Parton talks about never being married to Porter Wagoner despite the media coverage -- Parton talks about her husband and still working with Wagoner -- Parton talks about her most recent project with Wagoner -- [break] -- Parton talks about how great her marriage is -- Parton talks about how important it is to have love in your life and that is how she was raised -- Parton talks about her favorite song being the Coat Of Many Colors and why -- Parton talks about her future projects, including a television show and more recordings -- Parton talks about swapping songs with Merle Haggard -- Suglia talks about ending the interview because of Dolly's throat and ends the interview -- Dolly Parton does an introduction for this interview to be broadcast on WBUK -- Dolly Parton does an introduction for this interview to be broadcast on WBUK
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Parton, Dolly, 1946-;
